name: Hotel Riu Palace Las Americas

reviews.text: I just returned from Cancun @ Riu Palace Las Americas with my daughter as part of her 21st birthday celebration. This is by far the most wonderful hotel I have ever visited! From the moment you walk in, the staff cannot do enough for you; with a smile.The hotel& grounds are breathtaking. We had a jr. oceanview suite with a beautiful view. We were on the 6th floor. The room was spotless as was the entire hotel. Food delicious,drinks came nonstop. Bartenders were great! Bed comfortable,room service prompt& friendly. Entire staff seemed honestly happy to serve you & we never passed a staffmember who did not greet us! The pool bar is fun as well as the swimup bar. The sister property, Riu Cancun, is also nice.You are able to use their hotel bar &resturant which is nice as the Palace facilities close earlier& this hotel is right next door. I had read some reviews saying beds were hard, no water pressure,etc. Not true!!! This is really a Palace!! Cannot wait to return. Thank you for a wonderful trip!!
reviews.title: Wonderful Place!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel for 4 nights. We booked through the RIU website as we got the best total price for hotel, flight and transfers. We have traveled to Cancun 4 previous times always with charter flights and this actually went smoother.
reviews.title: Perfect stress free stay

likes.disliked: — Bath tub, would have been happy with just a shower.

reviews.text: The flight was by NWA from Minneapolis, It left on time and the transfer to hotel was not difficult once we found the right company rep. We waited perhaps five minutes before the drive to the hotel.
reviews.title: Very nice compact hotel with awsome Ocean view rooms.

reviews.text: Check in at the hotel was quick and we were given an upgrade, according to clerk, to a room on 5th floor room facing the sea. We had not booked an ocean view room. The room was spacious with a nice balcony and beautiful view. The bathroom was nice with two sinks though the bathtub was disappointing, a small tub with sloping walls which made you alert while showering.
reviews.title: Totally enjoyed myself!

likes.disliked: — Buffets seemed repetitive, lack the overall customer service we are used in the US

reviews.text: Liquor dispenser contains Rum, Tequila, Vodka and Brandy I believe. We sampled the first three name brand liquors and they were good. The fridge was stocked daily with 6 Corona Beers, Pepsi, Diet Pepsi, 7 up and water bottles. Yep, I liked the room.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: Iv recently returned from the Riu Palace, I cant praise the staff high enough. We felt like we were spoiled like never before. I went with my sister for a quiet break, planning to rest and unwind. We assumed as it was mainly couples we would have spent most of the time on our own just having a meal then an early night... Not at all! Everyone mixes in with each other! We never even made it outside the hotel during our 1st week, there was no time!!! lol
reviews.title: The Holiday Of A Lifetime

reviews.text: Every day we were at the pool from early on until late afternoon/evening! The staff at the bars were amazing, so friendly and manerly...
reviews.title: Very Fine Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the pre booked restaurants most nights, but the buffett was fantastic, we went purely for a change of scene.
reviews.title: WORTH EVERY ONE OF IT'S 5 STARS - FANTASTIC

reviews.text: We had champagne for breakfast, most mornings. The waiters got to know what you liked to drink and where you liked to sit. These guys worked so hard! We had been advised by friends before we went to get plenty $1 bills, by giving the waiters a few $ a day,it was as if you gave them a fortune! They work so hard for very little pay...
reviews.title: Second of many visits

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our favourite restaurant was the Japanese and Krystal. The only 1 I was not blown away with was the Brazilian 1. During the day the was used as the Italian restaurant which was excellent... Im shocked by the negative comments which have been left on here in the past. I could not fault it. The beds were very comfortable, the rooms beautiful. The beach is small but the view is stunning!!! Food 1st class, drinks excellent. Location was ideal. We are now looking to return next year with a much larger group since all the family after seeing our photos want to go with us!!!
reviews.title: AMAZING HOTEL

reviews.text: Wanted to say "Hat's off to Eric". A group of 14 of us went on vacation to Cancun and needless to say things happen when you have a large group go on vacation. Well it turns out that the reservation for one of my son's was wrong don't know if I did it or the call center did it but in either case it was wrong and then my nephew had one of 4 nights stay at another Riu. This was only one of the things that went wrong the day we left. However when we arrived to the resort and I started to tell the reservation desk that i was having a bad day and wasy hoping he could help me because I had a few problems. Well Eric said I can help you but tell me one problem at a time and he made us feel like we didn't have any problems. I explained the problems he said "let's get everyone checked in first and make them comfortable and then work on the other reservations". Eric was great he canceled the other Riu reservation switched it over the right Riu and then did the same for my nephew. We had a great time and the staff over all was attentive to us during our stay, the food was great servers everyone. I would recommend staying again at Riu Palace Las Americas. Eric Thank you very much from all of us!
reviews.title: Customer Service - Eric

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel from June 24 - June 27. The room was immaculate. We have the full ocean view room with no extra charge. All the staffs are friendly, especially Dennis one of the waiters at Don Roberto. The hotel is very clean. No wonder they call it PALACE. The architecture of the hotel is amazing. We highly recommend this hotel. Thank you Riu Palace for a unforgettable experience.
reviews.title: AMAZING

reviews.text: Staff, location, food, drink all amazing. Buffet restaurant excellent, all of the speciality restaurants fantastic. Beach and pools top notch. I couldn't fault this hotel if I tried. Sun all day ( if you want it) shade all day ( if you want it!) waking distance to bars/restaurants and plenty of shops both local and international brands. 3 other Rius in walking distance which you can use. Would I recommend this place? Yes! Will I be back? Yes!
reviews.title: 13th-27th June

reviews.text: A large group of us (29 people) went to Cancun to celebrate our 40th B-Days. This was my second and last time staying at a RIU resort, (Cabo and Cuncun). This review is about the one in Cancun. Our stay was 7 nights. The beds are terrible, like laying on a rock, and the food was okay. The pool bar was fantastic and the entertainment staff was great at the pool bar. The way they do the sit down dinner reservations is awful. They only give times for 2 seating's a night and limit the amount of people. We only got a chance to eat at the steak house because of this but was told by others in our group the food was okay at the other places. Plus guys have to wear long pants to all sit down dinners, which is insane in Mexico in June. That has to be the dumbest rule ever. Guys weren't allowed to wear dress shorts but we saw one guy wear jogging pants and they let him in. Women could wear what ever they wanted. The steak house was extremely hot and we couldn't enjoy the food, although was pretty tasty but some of us got sick after. The beach was very nice, small, but no beach umbrella's at all. There were umbrella's at the pool but not on the beach which we thought was very strange considering the other RIU next door which is a step below this one had umbrella's. The breakfast and lunch buffet were above average. The Dinner buffet was just average. They didn't mix up the type of food that was served like they did in Cabo. Cabo's dinner buffet was awesome. You want good Mexican food go across the street from the resort to the Sea Horse. The late night pizza place took forever, pizza was okay but the service was terrible. I had to complain several times before we got our food. The drinks at the bar's were very good and strong. We spent most of our day at the pool bar and the entertainment staff did a great job. There was volleyball, basketball, Olympic games, aerobics and much more activity in the pool than I expected. The water balloon fight was awesome. Don't get me wrong we had a great time but just wouldn't stay at another RIU again.
reviews.title: Fun Trip with Friends but won't go back to RIU

reviews.text: This hotel is exactly as it says " Palace". From the moment we arrived it was first class all the way. The drinks were amazing and free flowing. The beach was amazing. Big rocks to snorkel around and don't have to worry about any small ones. I would suggest to bring your own snorkeling gear as they charge a federally 2.00 fee and didn't look to sanitary. Food was spectacular bravo to the chef cooking omelets yummy!!!!!! Be sure to bring "long pants" or you cant eat at some of the restaurants. I recommend making dinner reservations early for all week. Eat at the hotel it's better free and just easier when your in a group. THE STAFF IS SPECTACULAR! I have never in my life been treated so well they went above and beyond their call of duty to make sure we were taken care of. The only complaint I would have is they are semi handicap friendly only 3 rooms in the whole hotel on ground floor. And ramps are way out of they way. There are no ramps into or around any pools or hot tubs, and only 1 handicapped bathroom by the pool that everyone seems to disregard the "handicapped" sigh attached out on the door so there was a 5 minute wait every time we had to get to the bathroom, and the spa was extremely overpriced. That was a bummer but other than that I had the time of my life. It was my first trip to Mexico but definitely not my last! See you again in 2014 Riu Palace Las Americas Cancun!!!!!!
reviews.title: First class all the way

reviews.text: My husband, daughter and I stayed at RPLA from Sep 8 to 15/2006. We had a wonderful vacation.
reviews.title: "Adorable place to stay"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In my opinion this beautiful and elegant property has a privileged location in Cancun. It’s close to everything. You can walk to the shopping mall, bank, nightclubs and bars.
reviews.title: Riu Palace Is Beautiful

likes.disliked: — desserts were bland. some foods could use more spice.

reviews.text: The beach is amazing; the water is clear, the seaweed is racked off the sand every morning.
reviews.title: What a Vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service is excellent. The staff is worth of admiration; they are friendly, helpful and hard working people. They managed to keep this hotel very clean and immaculate.
reviews.title: Beautiful, but . . .

likes.disliked: — The awful smell in my room and the elevator

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was nice and didn’t have any musty smell.
reviews.title: Riu Las Americas = the Perfect Vacation!!

reviews.text: First the BAD:
reviews.title: WILL NEVER GO BACK! Strong Mold Smell. Needs major make over. - Great Staff. Beautiful Pools & Beach.

reviews.text: ... We were very disappointed with our experience. We have always heard great things about the Riu hotels. We decided to give the Riu Palace a try thinking it would be a great experience. Boy were we wrong. This does not meet my Riu expectations. A Palace this was Not.
reviews.title: service perfecto!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: AWFUL SMELL- Immediately upon entering the hotel you get slapped in the face with a disgusting mold or damp basement stench. My family and I got instant headaches because of it. If you say something about the smell the staff will say it's due to being next to the beach. We travel a lot, all our hotels have been on the beach and none have ever smelled like this one. Rest assured the musty smell will follow you home. We were shocked when after emptying the suitcases the smell was still inside them. A week later and we are still airing them out. I've never had to wash clean clothes but this time around we had to re-wash clothes that we had paid to have cleaned two days prior to leaving. What a mistake & waste of money it was to think we could pack clean clothes and then just put it away when we got home. The decor looks like it was taken from my great grandma's house along with a hint of "old" smell attached. The ceilings have obviously had leaks and they've done a good'ol patchwork style fix on all of them. Yep you can see all the new fixes.
reviews.title: Great hotel style and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ELEVATORS, Oy! Do they need a make over. Not only have the railings inside been ripped off before, but you can see that they've also patch work fixed the laminated section of the wall. The side tiles are popped & no air conditioning in them. Just awful. There is carpet in a lot of sections of the hotel so one can only guess how much mold is underneath. They clean constantly so why does it smell so bad? A HINT OF ADVICE TO THE RIU CHAIN....INVEST IN DE-HUMIDIFIERS!
reviews.title: Las Americas Cancun Review - June 21-28

reviews.text: We brought air freshener spray & dryer sheets to try to keep our clothes from stinking but they didn't help one bit.
reviews.title: Check weather

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my wife and i just returned from a 3 night stay, our first vacation without our kids. my biggest complaint is that we should have stayed longer. the hotel is beautiful, staff is very friendly and helpful, if they don't all speak perfect english, well you're not in kansas anymore, suck it up and make an effort. location of the hotel is great, try and get an ocean view, worth a few extra dollars. there is a musty smell in the hotel but it's not that bad, especially considering where you are. the pools are great, the sea is perfect, activities abound if that's what you're looking for. the food is good, not great but for an all inclusive, it's above average. if you can't get a reservation at the restaurant you want, go there 15 minutes after the seating and if there are no shows (and there always are), you can get a table. book your tours outside of the hotel, you'll save alot of money and be on the same boats with the people that booked through the hotel. we will definitely go back, next time we'll bring the kids! there really isn't anything negative to say about our trip to this hotel, we would just be being super picky, it's amazing what some people will complain about
reviews.title: can't wait to go back

reviews.text: We stayed here last September. We had a great holiday and would go back, if it wasn't for the smell of damp. Despite washing everything twice when we got back our summer clothes still reek of damp and we have had to by new cases for our next trip. Believe what you read here, the smell is awful and the tour operators should act on behalf of their clientele.
reviews.title: THAT SMELL!

reviews.text: We stayed at Riu Palace Las Americas last week of May 2011. The weather was great. It was hot, but we like it. This is our second time staying at this hotel and we just love it. First time was in August 2010. The food is GREAT! The ocean is amazing! Great snorkeling (best in August). No waves, so kid friendly. We have a 4-year-old and she loved it. This hotel never gets waves because of the position of the shore.
reviews.title: Great destination wedding!

reviews.text: We had wedding here and it was magical. The pictures were amazing, the photo team are great!!! Highly recommend!
reviews.title: "Out of this world"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is mild musty smell in the lobby from high humidity, but its not bad at all, and you get used to it in the first 3 seconds. All hotels in this area smell like that.
reviews.title: Absoultely Amazing!!!!!! Can not wait to go back!!

reviews.text: What an awesome and amazing place. Everything was perfect about the hotel! The location, the artchitecture, the food, the drinks, the pools, the beach, the service, the rooms - everything! The best place I have ever stayed!
reviews.title: AMAZING - We had our wedding there

reviews.text: If you plan to have your wedding in Mexico and are planning to mail boxes to the resort. DONT use the post office (The Mexican post office would not deliver our boxes for some reason, they never did tell us why). We had to hire an outside delivery service that saved the day! The are bilingual and helped us so much with the post office, they got our boxes to us and were awesome to work with - use: CICSA Logistics if you want to be sure your things get to your hotel!
reviews.title: I agree with average at best!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, the spa is a different entity there, they had couple mix-ups with us and our guests. I don't recommend purchasing your services before hand like we did, just make your reservations when you get there to avoid any hassle. The beach hut massages were Awesome!
reviews.title: Very good Riu Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wedding was perfect, out at the gazebo. They took our blood, it was a completely safe and sterile. The paperwork was filled out and we got our official papers right after the wedding. It was run awesome! The even decorated our room with rose peddles heart animals, "Just Married" shirts and a bottle of champagne ready to pop in our room for after the wedding...
reviews.title: Riu Palace Las Americas, Cancun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was all so beautiful! I recommend!!! Anyone who had a bad review about the food is an idiot! The only thing I can think of is they are just unhappy people. The food was awesome, they even had lobster, muscels, shirmp at the buffet one night. Every night seemed to be a different theme but they had everything! It was all so good!!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel on the beach

reviews.text: I stayed here with two friends for the first week of April with the all inclusive package. When we first arrived we were greeted by the bright and friendly Alfredo! He gave us all the information we needed and was very helpful.
reviews.title: An Amazing Week!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked into our room and it was ocean view but on 1st level and in the center of the building which we were not too happy about as it had a balcony and then a large patio type area which obstructed most of our view. We went back down to reception to enquire about changing rooms and Alfredo did everything he could to assist. It was fully booked that day but a lot of people checking out the following day so we changed rooms to a higher level and were blown away by the view! Looking down at the pool and the crystal blue waters of the beach we were in heaven!
reviews.title: I miss it already!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were different pool areas... the main pool with bar (we were drinking Dirty Monkeys all week ugh I need one now!!) and activities like volleyball etc was fun. The entertainment crew were a lot of fun - Emily is a an absolute sweetheart! She was always having fun and interacting and getting the guests to have fun and socialise. They also took us out at night and every night is a different bar. Don't miss coco bongo night as the vip table is on a balcony looking down on the show!! So much fun!!
reviews.title: 1st Review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also hired a car from reception which was delivered to us and picked up from the hotel. It was very efficient and effortless.
reviews.title: Wish i went for longer :(

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the best week staying at Riu Palace Las Americas, I have already recommended it to my friends that will be going to Cancun soon and we would also definitely stay there again if we go back.
reviews.title: Great Vacation

reviews.text: Airport and Transportation:
reviews.title: Awesome Cancun Vacation at the RUI

reviews.text: Personnel customs took us about 5 minutes and luggage customs took about 15 minutes. Be cautious right after walking out the sliding doors after customs checks your bags. Once you go past the sliding doors there is a room full of “tourist advisors”. These are the same guys who annoy you during the entire trip attempting to sell you tourist attractions. Some will even chase you down to get a sale, I thought that was funny. You could probably get a great deal if you want to reserve some type of tour but they will take up your time and the deal gets better and better as you walk away just like buying anything else at a high tourist spot.
reviews.title: Riu Post Wilma Piece by Piece

reviews.text: I ended up reserving a car with a driver from Cancun Vans for $48 roundtrip. This was great because only 1 car was in the airport parking area, which was our reserved car, with the driver holding up our name on a sign. As we drove off, I looked back and saw a lot of the other vacationers either sitting on the curb waiting for a ride or attempting to load up with others. (in and out it was great!)
reviews.title: Great Resort, absolute paradise
Very bad, would not recommend
reviews.text: Junior Suite:

reviews.title: Great vaca despite Wilma
reviews.text: I checked in on Dec. 15th and was first assigned a room with no ocean view suite #501, which was what I had reserved. I didn’t think it would hurt, so I asked if they could switch me to an ocean view suite (#220) and they did with NO extra charge or tip!!! My wife and I were very pleased with our room and ocean view. Spectacular View, see picture!

Let me start off by saying that this hotel was a difficult review because for every ‘bad’ experience, there was a ‘great’ experience waiting around the corner. This is a long account, so I appreciate your patience. So, here are my .02:
reviews.title: A 3-4 star hotel with 5 star service.

likes.liked: — Location; otherwise too many to name.
likes.disliked: — Food needs drastic improvement. All facets: the taste as well as the service of were substandard.

reviews.text: First the positives:
reviews.title: First trip to Mexico-Glad it was at the Riu Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: + : We were actually slated to stay @ the RIU Cancun next door. Upon arrival, we were greeted with the beer. NICE touch. And we were upgraded for FREE @ the PALACE. NICER touch. NO wait. GREAT service.
reviews.title: Loved the Riu Palace!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: +: We were also greeted by a FUNJET rep, Victor. Great, energetic, honest guy who got all of our clubbing (and gentlemen’s club) excursions out of the way as soon as we got there. -0- complaints.
reviews.title: Perfect Trip!!!

likes.liked: — The view of the ocean, the service and the food!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: +: Both grounds were top notch. Great hotel! Aesthetically pleasing. Pools and surrounding areas were SPECTACULAR. Space was never an issue at the beach nor at the pool(s).
reviews.title: Not a honeymoon destination

likes.disliked: — Room and poor response at front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't say that we had a bad time at the Riu, but I'm not sure why this hotel is rated as highly as it is. We selected it based upon the high rating and people's comments, and while we weren't outrageously disappointed, it was not as upscale as we were expecting.
reviews.title: Not sure why it is rated so highly...

likes.disliked: — Disappointing food, amenities, and lack of sun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before arrival I requested to make reservations at the steakhouse. The manager was nice enough to make them for us - I would really recommend this as when we arrived and tried to make reservations, it was difficult to get them as everything was booked through Sunday (we arrived Thurs AM and were leaving Monday). Also, we were upgraded to oceanview upon arrival which was nice. Our room was ready when we arrived at noon and we were served a nice welcome drink upon arrival.
reviews.title: Just great! Amazing resort with everything you need!

reviews.text: ROOM - the room was ok in size. The room was kept very clean - very good housekeeping, but none of the cute touches we have grown to expect like towel animals, fresh flowers, etc. The minibar was supposed to only be restocked every other day - they came every day to look at ours. It was great to have soda, water, Coronas, and liquor in the room. The bed was 2 double beds pushed together and even for people that love a hard mattress, this was really hard. Cheap linens and towels were used. We had a balcony overlooking the ocean - a gorgous view. Unfortunately, the balconies aren't that big - I'm used to comfy chairs or lounges and this was two cheap flimsy white chairs.
reviews.title: Wonderful - As Always

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FOOD - I'm amazed at all of the reviews that said that the food was great. It's not great. It's average for an all-inclusive. I was most surprised that they don't offer a Mexican restaurant on-site and they usually only have 1 or 2 Mexican dishes (not very good either) at each meal. We came to Mexico to eat Mexican food, not to eat the same dishes we can have at home! They serve a lot of meat and then they re-serve it the next day in a different sauce. Breakfast was great, with a ton of choices, including a bloody mary bar, hot breakfast cooked to order...but again, I would like to see Mexican breakfast options. Lunch & Dinner were ok at the buffet - a LOT of meat dishes and very bland meatless side dishes. They don't have a snack bar which I am used to from other all-inclusives, so you can't easily get a snack of french fries or hamburger when you are hungry - you actually have to go to the restaurant and they don't encourage you taking food out of the restaurant. We went to the steakhouse and it was just ok. The steak was overcooked, tough, and lightly seasoned. Not even close to 5 star...more like a steak you would order at Applebee's. Room service menus had about 5 items on it, but they were all just ok. Took about 30-60 min to get it delivered. We also tried Los Arcos for lunch and that was ok. My husband liked the filet you can get there and they have a nice selection of different options.
reviews.title: I have been seven times in Cancun, but never had so bad food.

likes.liked: — I have been seven times in Cancun, but never had so bad food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: BAR - BEST service I've had at an all-inclusive for alcohol service. We would be laying out at the pool and constantly being offered drinks to be delivered to us. It was awesome!!! No waiting around here - some all-inclusives don't let you drink before 10 or 11AM - not here!! You can have a drink whenever you want and we saw a lot of mimosas being poured at breakfast! Drinks were great, excellent selection, they used some top-shelf, but mostly well liquors, but still - awesome drinks!!!! Nothing to improve here other than possibly upgrading the liquors, but we don't mind so much. They even serve shots which a lot of all-inclusives don't.
reviews.title: Elegant Hotel with Great Service!

reviews.text: I was a bit leary after reading some of the reviews about the resort, but found them to be in many cases sour grapes. There were a few negatives, mainly other guest related, but overall it was a positive experience. The place was very clean and staff very positive and friendly. Almost all greeted you with a smile and an Hola. Wait staff were very accomodating and ready to bring drinks. Rooms were very clean. The beds were a bit firm, but still comfortable with the added pillow tops on the mattresses. If it is not in place all you have to do is request one. The food was fresh and filling at the buffet. We visited two of the specialty restaurants....the Brazilian and the International. The Brazilian was the best of the two. All staff were nice and helpful even though tipping was not required or expected.
reviews.title: Wonderful Getaway

reviews.text: A wedding was being held poolside and a few guests were loud and splashing in the poll. The hotel should have stopped this or emptied the pool for a few minutes until it was over. Over all the pool and beach were wonderful. The beach was large enough, I was worried due to some other reviews. There were plenty of beach loungers and loungers around the pool areas. There were some instances of towels being left all day, but we were still able to find somewhere to lounge.
reviews.title: 3 Star at BEST!!!

reviews.text: I would recommend that the hotel post instructions in the rooms about how to work the light switches. It was pretty confusing the first day.
reviews.title: Smells+Hot+Dirty

reviews.text: I recently stayed at this alleged 5 star hotel and was HIGHLY disappointed. Let's start with the fact that the bathroom had no vents so when I took hot showers thw mirror would stay fogged up for atleast the next hour. Also, because there were no vents the beds always felt damp. The double beds that we asked for were pushed together to make one bed. The room smelled like ammonia upon entering so we had to go to Walmart to get air freshners. Room service had too many restrictions. I had to go to a vending machine for cappuccino becasue they did not deliver cappuccino to the rooms, nor did they deliver any kind of juices. They were short on the covers that are placed over your food when food is delivered so he had to take the covers back which meant that I had to eat the food immediately and if I by chance didn't like it, I had to smell the scent of the food until someone came to retrieve it. Whenever you called for room service 9 out 10 times the person answering the phone did not know English which was very frustrating. The view was horrible and although there were rooms available (garden views) with better views they refused to give us an upgrade. She stated that they were booked and when I asked her if we could check-out the next day and chek into a new room, my request was denied. The food was not appetizing at the Palace so we ate daily at the Riu Cancun. The cleaning woman threw away receipts among other things that clearly were not trash but leave the empty potato chip bag. The transportation that we paid extra for forgot to call us for our pick-up, luckily I set my clock. This was actually the worse place that I have ever stayed, especially for the price.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the hotel was excellent except for a few minor problems.
reviews.title: Best All Inclusive

reviews.text: This was our second stay at the Palace and it was again wonderful. The hotel truly is a palace. The service was impeccable, beach is fantastic, food excellent and views breathtaking. If you are looking for elegance this is the place for you. You also have the opportunity to visit the Cancun or Caribe if you are looking for a change of pace. At any rate there is nothing negative we could say about this place.
reviews.title: Simply The BEST

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at RIU Las Americas from Dec 4th - 8th. The hotel and the landscaping were beautiful. For starters we had an ocean front room on the 2nd floor. The toilet didn't work. Call the front desk they took care of the problem. We decide to go grab a bite to eat; the food was not good at all. We made reservation that night at Tito Pepe, the food wasn't no better. The next morning the toilet was broken again. Made reservation again at Los Arcos and the food was worst. For the duration of the trip we ate off premise. Went back to the room and the door wouldn’t open we walked to the front desk and security was sent to unlock the door. Call the front desk again and asked what was taking so long, I was told “maintenance was off duty”. Asked for a manager and was told “management was gone for the day and wouldn't return until 10 A.M.” the next following day, ask how am I to get back into my room if I should leave again, I was told security was assist me. Now this was the kicker another guest was there complaining about his service and was quite irate, he was told "don't talk to me in that manner or I will call the police and you don't want to go to jail in Mexico" the guest said I know my rights, he was told your rights are not the same in Mexico. It appeared that he was using that “never go to jail in Mexico cliché to his advantage. (Our maid bellman and waiters was very friendly I can't the same for the rest of the employees.) The next morning I spoke with management, he apologizes and sent me a bottle of champagne and tequila. Called the front desk requested a better iron, but to no avail and finally the toilet broke again.
reviews.title: A Honest Review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Outside of the toilet the room was comfortable and the view was beautiful, just the food was awful and so was the front desk. Unless it was free I wouldn’t stay again.
reviews.title: Riu Palace Riviera Maya is better.

reviews.text: My Husband and I stayed at the Riu Palace Las Americas just before Thanksgiving. The hotel is beautiful. The beach is kind of small and was very crowded when we were there, but it is pretty. We enjoyed swimming in the ocean, the waves were just right. There are two pools, one with a swim up bar and the other without. Everyone gathered at the one with the swim up bar so you needed to get out there and put towels on chairs by about 7:30 am if you wanted to be in the sun.
reviews.title: It was good, but not great

reviews.text: There were hot tubs scattered over the property, but the only one that was actually hot was in the sauna, and that one was luke warm. The others were ice cold.
reviews.title: not a bad deal

likes.disliked: — the smell and the small pool area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from a 7 day stay at the Riu Palace las Americas. We were there from Sept 30th thru Oct 8th. It was the best vacation we have ever had. The hotel was beautiful. The rooms were very nice however we did see from other reviews that the beds were a little bit firm. But we requested a mattress pad and that helped a lot. The hotel grounds are extremely clean. Our room was cleaned 2 times a day. The staff were awesome. I have never received as much personal attention as we did at this hotel. We did read that for the specialty restaurants you had to book the night before. I met the hostess from the restaurants and tipped her 10.00 dollars and she booked me through the week at any restaurant we wanted. I recommend the Japanese restaurant. The food at the buffets were also very good. The hotel is in a perfect location with regards to walking distances. A mall across the street. A flea market less than a mile and the main clubs to cancun were also less than a mile.
reviews.title: Truly a Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did take a break from the hotel to have lunch at this restaurant called 'The Seahorse" which was right across the street from the hotel. The all you can eat mexican lunch special was fantastic. It was only $8.00. Great tacos and great soup.
reviews.title: Just wonderful

reviews.text: All in all we will be back to the Riu Palace for our next vacation.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We met couples that never left the hotel because of what was offered there.
reviews.title: Good location but not impressed

likes.liked: — The beach, the pools, the cocktails
likes.disliked: — Food, the smell, limited wine & beer list

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Great property!

reviews.text: i have just written a review....got half way through and decided to get rid of it all and sum it up in 1 paragraph
reviews.title: steady..all depends what your after

reviews.text: for the money this is a steady option. locatated v near the party district ithis clean ,safe popular hotel does suffer from lots of shade during the day. food is plemtyful but not gourment and rooms are clean if a bit too fragrant ( and no its not the " carribean smell ").Wide age range of people . Weddings , families and groups of boys and girls and solo travlers. The vast amount of booze does promote the rowdy bunch but does not get away from the fact that the shows are naf but the entertianment staff do work v hard like all staff. Its very similar to next door but worth the extra cash ?
reviews.title: Solid Hotel but Prefer other RIU's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: finally reception here are intressting . Compared with next door they are misarable unhelpful and let the place down. guys take a leaf from the other staff . but dont let this put you off.
reviews.title: This place should be called a 10***** It is AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!

likes.liked: — EVERYTHING The service is number ONE!!!!!! AMAZING place to stay!!!

reviews.text: .enjoy if you go
reviews.title: Would not be my first choice

likes.disliked: — Lack of restrooms in common areas, narrow beach, no activities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have stayed at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya, Pacifico and now the Las Americas.
reviews.title: Stay away!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from seven nights at the Riu Palace Cancun. I read a lot of the reviews here leading up to our trip, so I will give my review, pros and cons, of what most people here are talking about.
reviews.title: Great trip to Cancun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Start with the pros:
reviews.title: best yet

reviews.text: Check in was good, no room when we got there, but it was also 11:30am, but they gave us wristbands and towel cards, so we were able to eat, drink and use the pool. We got our room at 2:30pm.
reviews.title: TOTAL RELAX!!!

reviews.text: Check out was good as well, I read some reviews of people saying that they "kick you out", yes the make you leave you room at noon, somebody else needs to get into it, but you are still able to use all the hotel amenities up till you need to leave.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service at the restaurants and bars was great. We tipped after every drink and every meal, however, those who weren't tipping appeared to be getting just as good of service as we did. Anyone who says that people not tipping are being overlooked by the staff must have done something to be getting overlooked.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: We stayed at the RPLA from Feb 10-17th. We booked a jr. suite with ocean view. It was very nicely appointed and the view was wonderful--we had a corner room on the 6th floor which overlooked both pools. We had no problems getting chairs for sun bathing--we hung out by the pool closet to the ocean--which has a swim up bar. The room was kept very clean. The food and wine was by far the best we have experienced with an all inclusive RIU hotel--we have stayed at four others--Playacar (RIU Playacar and Yucatan), Tulum and Punta Cana. We enjoyed the food at the specialty restaurants except for the Japanese. The Krytal restaurant was our favorite--they had French cuisine the evening we ate there--the filet was as good as Ruth's Chris'. We read many of the reviews below and took many dollar bills for tips. Again, the reviews were also correct--the wait staff did not expect a tip but was very appreciative when they received one. The location of the hotel is convenient to a flea market, an artist market, and many bars and restaraunts. We only ventured out to the flea market to buy some vanilla and t-shirts.
reviews.title: A great place to relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been to most of the local tourists attractions on our previous visits and were happy to stay at the resort and sun bathe, people watch, and eat and drink. The beer, wine and liquor were all premium and the mixed drinks were NOT watered down.
reviews.title: beware of musty smell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of the visitors were mid-30ish up--we are in our mid to late 50's. Very few small infants--we saw/heard many of those at the RIU Cancun, an adjacent resort were we had cocktails one evening. Most of the couples who brought children were anywhere from 8-15 years of age and without exception were very well behaved in public. Most of the vacationers were Americans, however there were a good deal of Europeans, which was good--With the dollar being low in value compared to the Euro, many more Europeans can now afford to travel to Mexico and the US.
reviews.title: Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a very pleasant experience; one we would repeat providing the dollar doesn't fall much lower.
reviews.title: best holiday ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main problem with our stay at the Riu palace was the musty smell throughout the entire hotel. We stayed on the second floor and the smell was very bad. I went up several floors to see if there was the odor and it seemed to be present on those floors also. I noticed the smell coming from the ventilation.It could be they never changed the carpets from the last hurricane also??? I had a alergic reaction after the second day that lasted the entire week.
reviews.title: loved the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great time, and the hotel is beautiful with a very attentive staff!
reviews.title: Great For Price
Excellent resort!
reviews.text: I will categorize my comments for easier reading:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Accomdations - new, clean, beautiful view, and modern. Stocked bar, and attentive staff (speak little English though)
reviews.title: Beautiful, Relaxing, and Accommodating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Pool & Beach - Very nice, and beach was clean, and pretty. No trash, hotel makes sure its clean, drinks were delivered to us, which is important to my vacation
reviews.title: Very beautiful hotel and great staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Excursions - Some of the best I've ever had, so many to choose from, booked directly through hotel
reviews.title: You can't go wrong at the Riu!
Can't wait to return!!!
reviews.text: This hotel was absolutely gorgeous! From the 2 pool areas and the beautiful view, to the beautiful rooms, we had an absolutely wonderful vacation and would definately return. The service was great. We enjoyed all of the dining choices..my favorite was the "tapas" restaurant and my husband loved the authentic Mexican buffet. Don't pass this by!

reviews.title: Hotel fabulous; Hospitality of staff blows you away
reviews.text: We stayed at the Riu Palace Feb 26 - March 3. We were absolutely impressed by the wonderful staff, service, and accomodations at the Riu Palace. These people work so hard and always greet you with smiles and Hola's. The hotel is beautiful inside and out. What we loved:

1. Meals were great at the 3 buffet, steak, and Brazilian restaurants we tried. We did not try the Japanese or gormet places. Our favorite was the Brazillian restaurant with 6 different meats served at the table on "swords". Jorge made it great fun too.
reviews.title: Great Vacation, Would do it Again!
*Best Vacation of my Life*
reviews.text: 2. Staff service in lobby and at restaurants was great.

reviews.title: Great combination of American Luxury and Mexican Style
reviews.text: 3. Pool outside of lobby looking towards ocean is stunning.
This was the second time we've stayed at this resort. The first time was May 2006. We had a great time that time, so we chose to stay at Riu again.
reviews.title: Second time around--still great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOMS
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a junior suite but not an oceanview. However, a week before we arrived I sent them an email requesting an oceanview if possible. Luckily there were some available the day we checked in. We stayed on the 8th floor, some of which does not have balconies, including ours. I liked the firm mattress, and I slept well every night. I had also mentioned in the email that this was our seond time, and they sent us a lovely fruit plate, a small bottle of tequila and a small ceramic mexican figurine as a gift, which was really nice and unexpected.
reviews.title: loved the palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FOOD
reviews.title: 5 Stars Plus In Every Way

reviews.text: They changed the reservation system so now you can do it all in advance. We ate at Sir Arthurs (Gourmet), Tio Pepe (Tapas) and Los Arcos (Brazilian). The food was decent, but I preferred the buffet. There was a lot of fresh seafood at all the venues though. We really liked going to Los Arcos for lunch (Italian). I highly recommend the shrimp there. All the drinks were great. Some days around noon or in the evening they set up a little table in the lobby and make mexican coffee (with kahlua, honey liquor and vanilla ice cream). It was delicious!
reviews.title: Impeccable Service

likes.disliked: — The odor near the elevators by the shops

reviews.text: This is probably the most beautiful hotel we have ever stayed at. It will take your breath away. My favorite water views, up until now were in Aruba and the Bahamas. Not anymore, the waterviews here are exceptionally beautiful. Now for the downside...
reviews.title: Gorgeous, but what's that smell...
Best hotel in cancun
reviews.text: I don't know about you, but when I go on vacation I can't wait to get a drink at the swim-up bar and start relaxing, meeting new people and having a good time getting to know my fellow travelers.(My husband and I are in our 40's and 50's, so we're not talking spring breakers here by a long shot, just a happy couple in need of a vacation) Well, that never happened because of the horrific smell at the bar. I actually held my nose time and time again whenever we went into the main pool area. It is so nasty, it makes you gag. There simply is no escaping it,unless you sit away from the pool itself or you go to the quiet pool. The resort is absolutely gorgeous, the service is great and the food is pretty good. You won't find any great fish here, lots of beef, pork and chicken. The only fish I found in five days was a local small flat filet with some sort of spicy rub on it. The breakfast and lunch buffets were good. It's the dinner buffet and some of the meals in the specialty restaurants that were a bit lacking. You know by now from other reviewers, that you must make your specialty restauant reservations between 5:00PM and 6:00PM the day before in order to get in. So, on your first night you are eating at the buffet, like it or not. However, actually getting there at 5:00PM is too late. People start lining up at 4:15PM, for example, for the Japanese sushi restuarant. Waiting in line every day is not my idea of fun. It's actually quite a ridiculous requirement. You wind up rushing back to the hotel to be on line "in time" every day if you happen to be away from the hotel for a tour or something. I did hear the Portugese restaurant in the lobby was very good, by the way, and the steak house on the outside patio of the buffet area was also very good. The best bartender is outside the Japanese restaurant (Rudolfo). Not only does he make good umbrella drinks, but he's funny too!If champagne is your drink of choice, like mine, the champagne flows day and night here. The large lounge and adjoining bar are beautiful. The lobby bar is stunning and fun, though seems to attract a lot of smokers for some reason. The resort quiets down early. No noisy revelers here. This is an adult resort. People get dressed for dinner and everyone acts maturely. There are some singles here, but mostly in their 30's and 40's from what we saw. The entertainment is interesting. The Michael Jackson impersonator was incredible. He could easily work in Vegas if he wanted. My husband raved for two days about the cuban dancers (I'm sure the scantily clad beautiful women couldn't be what he was actually raving about, could it?) I forgot to mention, we waited several hours to get a room, but it was worth it. They upgraded us to a room with a huge balcony - what a view. When they say check-in is at 3:00PM they mean it! All in all, we had a nice time except for the above mentioned complaints. If being at the pool is not important to you, you will enjoy the beach and my swim-up bar complaint won't make a difference to you. If you order room service every morning like we did in order to get our first cup of coffee and tea (there are no coffee makers in the room) check off the box that indicates a time at least a 1/2 hour earlier than you would normally want it. You could even have breakfast delivered if you write what you want in the box on the same order form. Not many people realize it, but above and below the outside patio buffet are jacuzzi's. Just walk up the stairs near the towel hut for the outside jacuzzi and down the steps for the bathrooms, spa and two underground jacuzzis. That's it for now, take your camera and enjoy.

Hotel was first class all the way. Food was above and beyond what i expected. I gained so much weight the week i was there. Service was excellent...they called our room every other day to see if we needed anything. Eat at the steak house...ribeye is superb. The only bad thing i can say is that the beds are hard as mentioned on here...but honestly its not that bad. Drink a few more coronas and you will never know. Pools are gourgous and you can get sun from 8 in the morning till 5:30 in the evening. Waiters are everywhere making sure you have plenty to drink while laying at the pools. I will stay here every time i visit cancun, and look into there other properties when i travel to those places
reviews.title: Riu is FANTASTICO!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Riu for a week and truly was amazed everyday. The decor is stunning. The attention to detail is amazing. The entire staff is smiling and saying hola. The bell boys remember your name as do the wait staff and bartenders.
reviews.title: Loved the Riu
Got really sick at Riu Palace
reviews.text: The food was very good. We enjoyed the buffet as well as all the a la carte restaurants. Never had anything I didn't like.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went here between 9/11 to 9/18 of this year for our honeymoon. We loved it so much, that we're planning on going back soon. The service was spectacular, the food was amazing, and everything all around was perfect. Only complain I have is the funny dampy beach smell in the room, but then again we are right on the beach. As soon as we got there, they upgraded our room for ocean view. It was beautiful. We sat on the balconey a lot during the evening for sunset watching. We ate a lot! The food at the buffet was surprisingly good; I usually dont like buffets. The other restaurants were also good; at first I didnt like having to make a reservation the day before, but I was actually able to make a reservation the day of with no hassle, just as long as they got room, they dont care! I recommend this hotel for couples only, not so much families or singles. Loved it!!!!
reviews.title: Best Hotel I've Ever Been To!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since there are so many trip reports about RPLA and most of them are very accurate, we’ll try not to repeat much of what has been reviewed in the past.
reviews.title: RPLA - Our 5th Stay - Easy To Love And Hard To Leave

reviews.text: Airport: We arrived Tuesday, Sept. 12. The airport was EMPTY. We walked right up to customs and after picking up our luggage (and getting a RED light when pressing the button) we were in the van in 30 minutes!
reviews.title: Excellent, but with a couple of words of caution

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 5th trip to RPLA so when we arrived we were greeted not with a punch cocktail, but with our favorite – white zinfandel. Our room was beautiful, as usual, ocean view 5th floor. We had no problems with our room the whole week – not even a musty smell. The hotel was at 45% when we arrived, then got a lot more people over the weekend for the Mexican Independence Day celebrations, and on Monday dropped to 37%.
reviews.title: Loved the Riu Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weather was perfect – the best of our last 5 trips. We spent so much time at the beach, swimming and snorkeling, that we never had time to leave the resort. The ocean water temperature had to be in the 80’s. The pool temperature was too warm, much like bath water. We don’t go here for the pools anyway. We are real beach people. If you like to swim, this is the best beach for that as it is always calm. We were happy to see the water got back to crystal clear this trip, as it hadn’t been that way since the hurricane. It was nice to see your feet again. There was very little seaweed, and the beach was cleaned every morning. The resort is very compact and convenient to get around. It takes only a very few minutes to go from your room to the beach, restaurants or the bars. This is a real plus, in our opinion.
reviews.title: Affordable Luxury
Definitely a beautiful place!
reviews.text: I stayed at Riu Palace between December 15 and 19, 2005 and I must say this place is gorgeous! I booked a Jr. Suite and it was on the 3rd floor overlooking the ocean. The room was very clean and was fairly big with a sitting area, king size bed and balcony. I asked for a mattress pad as another reviewer suggested and it made quite a difference. The lobby area and lobby bar are very nice, service is great and the people working at the hotel are so nice to you, polite, always smiling, etc. Yes, there are those folks that think nothing is good enough for them and write reviews as if they thought they were royalty and although this is not a 5 star hotel in it's own right, I would say it is pretty close and I'd give it 5 stars! First off, the price for this trip was a total bargain (I paid twice as much to go to Jamaica and it was a complete waste of money); although the hurricane left its mark in Cancún they are recovering quickly. There was absolutely no damage to Riu Palace other than the palm trees which took a beating. I did not try the restaurants requiring reservations, but heard they were pretty good. The thing is, you have to make reservations at a certain hour of the day (I believe between 5PM and 6PM) for the following night. Personally, I was not about to worry about making the reservations on time, so I just didn't even try. The food at the main restaurant (Don Roberto's I believe) was decent but this is where I give it only 4 stars (then again I struggle because the price of the trip was so low, I could not expect top of the line items). As far as the mildew or mold another reviewer reported, I did not see any indication of mold in my room and I did check. The place is extremely humid and yes ocean mist will come into your room, but for God sakes, you are staying by the OCEAN!! This cannot be helped and you will have the same experience around the world when you stay by the water, unless the hotel is hermetically sealed and you are not allowed to open windows. I opened the window one morning then turned around and the floor in my room was completely soaked! It's just the way it is when you are right next to the ocean... So expect it! Lastly, the salty water will certainly make your clothes and room smell due to the fact your clothes stay pretty damp the whole time. My clothes and suitcase did smell also and I brought it back with me... but I left the suitcase out in the sun for a day and the smell is gone!! Overall my experience was great and I had a blast!

reviews.title: Always high class...
reviews.text: I Stayed at the RIU PLA in Feb. 2005. I arrived there by luck, as I had purchased an Apple Vacations Square Deal - you pick the quality and they pick the property. This is the 2nd Square Deal, and I have always been thrilled with the property that I have been assigned to. Now, back to the RIU...

reviews.title: Mold and Mildew In Room - Horrible
reviews.text: Having stayed at 2 other RIU properties in MX, I already had an idea of what to expect - the 2 double beds pressed together to make a king, the liquor dispenser, lots of marble and stunning landscaping & architecture.
The room was nice - regular things. The double sink was a bonus. The tub wall was a little tall and hard to get into with a buzz on...
reviews.title: Ok for what it was
RLPA was good but Cancun needs time
reviews.text: The lobby was spectacular, as were all of the common areas. There are 2 infinity pools, one quiet and under utilized, with the other being the active pool with the famous RIU swim up bar (See pics).

reviews.title: Riu Rocks!
reviews.text: My family (8 of us) recently stayed at RLPA and it was one of the best vacations of our lives.

reviews.title: Had a blast
reviews.text: The good:

reviews.title: Riu Las Americas , best service ever !!!
reviews.text: - the beach, beautiful

reviews.title: Go to this hotel!!- You wont regret it!
reviews.text: - the hotel- rooms, lobby, bars all top notch

reviews.title: The best
reviews.text: - the staff, very helpful and friendly... especially the animacion staff. These young people work 15 hrs a day and are always smiling.

reviews.title: Absolutely awesome
reviews.text: I highly reccomend this place! It was beautiful. I have been to many places and many islands and I have to say that this is by far the BEST place that I have ever stayed at. Without going into details of how beautiful it was & how good the service & food was just know that you will be humbled if you stay here.
Feel free to contact me via email for any specific questions.
reviews.title: Were going back asap Can't wait
Great hotel...
reviews.text: We have been to Cancun 7 times not inc this time. RPLA IS HEAD AND SHOULDERS ABOVE THE ONES THAT We have been to.(Cancun Palace, Golden Crown princess, Sheraton)went next store to the Rui Cancun and it seemed a younger group overall. Still very nice through. At the Rui Palace the food was Excellant,
service great, room was much nicer than all of the above. Just take some dollars for tips and be sure you tip every one( it cost me about a hundred dollars
reviews.title: Great Trip, Love to Be Back Right Now!

reviews.text: in $1 bills)for 5 days. Money well spent. I would have been at the cancun palace if not for the hurricane. I think they have lost me to the RUI.any questions? email me.
reviews.title: Awesome place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you read reviews that tell you that this resort is like a cruise ship on land, this couldn't be more true! Right down to the regimented dining and "entertainment" and little plastic bracelets .We stayed 5 nights at the Riu Las Americas in November, the week of thanksgiving. First, the weather was not great, rain or atleast heavy clouds 3 of the 5 days and very heavy wind that made it chilly to be in the pool even when the sun was out. At check in we had no problem getting a king size bad and matress pad (everything you hear about rock hard matresses TRUE), we did have to wait about an hour for our room to be ready and tipped the guy heavily. There is a musty smell, but nothing to write home about..Our second night there, some drunk guy vommited on the floor in the middle of the bar /lounge, the staff cleaned it up promptly but didn't seem at all surprised almost like it happens all the time and the smell lingered for hours.
reviews.title: Just OK...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made all of our dinner reservations the first hour there and had no problem getting one for every night, beware, if you are 10 minutes late for your reservation they simply give it away, there is usually a line of guests outside the restaurants without reservations waiting for someone to not show up. These restaurants are exactly what you would expect for an all inclusive, salty, bland,and it truly does all start to taste exactly the same. The buffets are better than the sit down restaurants. The "gourmet" restaurant for example, the server we had from the night before at the brazilian carrying a big skewer of meat, is wearing a vest and white gloves, but the food is of the same so so quality.It's almost like a parody of a fancy restaurant, they were "out of" the fillet mignon so they served me a fatty rib eye with a piece of american cheese melted on top of it, you get the picture..The wine, all of it, is crap.
reviews.title: Thought RPLA was average to slightly above average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3 out of the five days when we arrived back at our room after a long day by the pool our room wasn't cleaned, not a big deal but a little irritating.The TV in the Junior Suite is in the seating area so if you want to watch from the bed you will have to angle it toward you from across the room.We didn't use the safe after reading other reviews regarding theft.
reviews.title: First Rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The crowd at this hotel was mostly families and couples, ALOT of children and when I say alot, I do mean alot. In the quiet pool and the activity / bar pool, loud kids everywhere you look, including in the jacuzzi!! On the colder days there were parents who actually dropped their kids off at the jacuzzi and left them there to play!!!! Infuriating! No real quiet relaxation at this resort. Getting lounges outside is difficult, and the same people go down everyday at dawn to reserve chairs with towels and books etc.. then leave them half the day to go eat or do other things.Drinks are abundant and poured however you like, thats about the only consistantly positive thing about this place.
reviews.title: Riu Palace - Best Romantic Vacation

likes.disliked: — Shady upgrade to ocean view room

reviews.title: Simpllyyy BeeeUtiful!
reviews.text: Had a decent massage in the spa, although the hot tub and cold plunge in the spa ARE NOT for the exclusive use of those paying for spa services, any hotel guest can come in anytime to use this facility, again, no peace and quiet to be found.

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, wonderful staff; I'd go back.
reviews.text: I have travelled quite a bit and I guess people are so picky anymore; it amazes me. I also went to Riu Tequila in July 2005 and I can see the similarities in the chain; the food selection, etc. but these people are amazing; so hard working and friendly. Also for the price of the packages including airfare and all you can eat and drink it really seems to be a good value. It's a beautiful hotel and I did notice some smell in the hallway but the room we had was fine. Very comfortable and I do recommend the mattress pad. The beach is small but there are two nice pools, but the water was cold when we were there. If you want long walks on the beach then go to another location, but if you just like to lay on the beach or by the pool and read or people watch it's great. All our meals were good but we liked the Sir Arthur for dinner and the Italian for lunch which is also in the Brazilian restaurant and we also liked that one for dinner and I agree, best guacamole and salsa I've ever had. Also this one has room service for breakfast so it's nice to get coffee delivered to your room if you need coffee in the morning and don't want to go down to the main bufett but the homemade donuts are worth the walk. Not fond of the hoops they make you jump through for reserving a spot in the restaurants, but that's how they do it and as a guest of Las americas you can go to the buffet in the Riu Cancun next door if you want. It seemed a bit larger than ours. It's pretty amazing because both Riu hotels; Las Americas and Cancun, which you can go next door and visit get a drink, eat at buffet, go to the show or disco, etc, are both beautiful and seem like an oasis down there now. We heard a lot of people on the bus to the airport talk about how their hotels should not even have been open yet. I didn't feel that way at all. So...relax, have a drink, sit in the sun and soak up such a pretty place!

We have travelled to Cancun 6 times in the last 9 years and stayed at different hotels. Our favorite was the Moon Palace, but not anymore. We loved this hotel, the architecture and decor are simply stunning. We had a king size bed (we've found that all beds in Mexico are hard) and a beautiful ocean view room (212) at the end of the of one of the hotel wings. We slept with the balcony door open every night so we could hear the waves crashing on the beach. Each room has a loveseat which is comfortable for watching TV or reading.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return!!

reviews.text: All of the staff were friendly, very helpful and we tipped at every meal because the service was so good. The food was generally very good, but our favourite was having an a la carte lunch each day at the Italian restaurant - Noe took excellent care of us. They also served wonderful marinated vegetables at the salad bar! Don Roberto, the main buffet restaurant was good for breakfast and dinner. We also tried 2 of the a la carte restaurants: the Japanese, the tempura was soggy, but main course was good; El Romero the steak and seafood were very good and they had a fellow playing music.
reviews.title: Beautiful, fully functional but smells of mold and it comes home with you!!!

reviews.text: The nightly shows were good, our favourite was the Broadway night, unfortnately we were not there for the Mexican show (usually those shows are beautiful). However, we were bothered by a lot of rude people smoking cigars with no consideration for the rest of us. That made the theatre hard to sit in most nights - we did watch one show through the window from the patio just to avoid the cigar smoke and my husband is a smoker!
reviews.title: All-Around Excellence at the Riu Palace Las Americas

reviews.text: It was sad to see the damage caused in Cancun by Wilma and I expect it will be a good year before things are back to normal. However, it was a wonderfully relaxing week away and we are looking forward to going back to the RUI Palace Las Americas again next year.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel Staff

reviews.text: First of all, I was booked at the Riu Cancun. I telephoned Riu Resorts prior to arrival to confirm that the resort was open and fully operational. They assured me everything was 100%. Upon arrival, I was informed that I was being taken to the Riu Palace Las Americas instead, because the Riu Cancun was not open. I was most upset, as I do not appreciate being lied to. I had the opportunity to change my travel plans through my travel agent, but declined to do so upon the assurance from Riu Resorts that all was fine at the Riu Cancun. Obviously, if I had wanted to stay at the Riu Palace Las Americas, I would have booked my vacation there originally.
reviews.title: Despite everything, we had a great time . . .

reviews.text: Now . . . on to the Riu Palace Las Americas:
reviews.title: Great Place visited 11-24 thru 12/01

reviews.text: The resort itself is beautiful, well-maintained, and very clean. My only complaints would be that the beds are hard as rocks, the walls are paper thin (at times you wonder if the people next door have somehow managed to get into your room with you), the showers are a project . . one minute it's burning hot, the next minute it's freezing cold, no matter how much you adjust the temperature, and the resort takes it upon themselves to make the air conditioning in the rooms non-existent when they feel it's not necessary; they simply shut it down, and all you get is the fan. Not comfortable, especially considering how humid it is in Cancun.
reviews.title: Cancun Lives in the RIU Palace
Please read before booking. 11-27-05
reviews.text: There were only two pools at this resort, one of which was supposed to be heated. It wasn't! They were both freezing cold. Imagine our surprise when we thought we were getting into a "hot tub", only to discover it was ice cold water with jets. We were told it was that way because the resort was trying to cut down on expenses. With the price I paid to stay at this resort, I was not pleased to hear that!

The food was okay. The themed restaurants were very disappointing. The buffet had many selections to choose from, but it was extremely repetitive; basically the same things day after day after day . . . the only difference was that on certain days some of the routine items were missing, and then they'd add them back again to make you think you were getting something different.
reviews.title: loved the Riu Palace--11-18-2005

description: * Located in "Corazone", Cancun???s resort area * On the beachfront * Complimentary sun loungers on the hotel???s private beach * 8-storey building * 100 m/325 ft. to Hotel Riu Cancun * 120 m/390 ft. from a shopping centre * 10 km/6.2 miles from downtown Cancun * 20 km/12.5 miles from the airport * Credit cards accepted: MasterCard, Amex, Visa
